ovdesc.p: The ACTIVITY.MAPPING component provides the link between external applications and arrangement activities when performing a debit or credit to an arrangement account. Customer initiated or scheduled debits and credits on an Arrangement are accomplished through T24 applications such as Funds Transfer, Teller, Clearing, etc. In order for the proper allocation rules to be used, each T24 Transaction must result in a specific Activity which would be triggered through AA.ARRANGEMENT.ACTIVITY application. This mapping could be done in this component.

desc.p: This field denotes the application period for the given periodic rule charges.
The periodic rule charges will be applied at the end of the period. If the value defined is zero, then the charges are applied immediately.
Standard T24 period field.

This field denotes the application method that needs to be applied to the periodic rule charges.

This field links AA to the other applications. When an external (non-AA) application raises a debit or credit movement to an arrangement account this needs to be translated to an activity on the arrangement. The transaction code of the underlying entry will be checked here and the associated TXN.ACTIVITY will be used. If the transaction code is not specified the DEFAULT.CR.ACTIVITY or DEFAULT.DB.ACTIVITY will be used based on the sign of the movement.
This field is part of a multi value set with TXN.ACTIVITY.
Input must be a valid record from TRANSACTION.

When a rule is broken what action needs to be taken is defined here. Currently, the various options available are
Error block further processing
Override Give an override
Information Record details only
CAP the rule value is to be used as a CAP if the rule is broken
FLOOR the rule value is to be used as a FLOOR if the rule is broken
Should be one of the above valid options

Input must be a valid OVERRIDE ID or EB.ERROR ID
Optional field - Allowed Values are RESETTING and NON-RESETTING.
RESETTING - During any Renewal Activities (for eg : change.product, rollover or reset) the property conditions will be reset from the product.
NON-RESETTING - During any Renewal Activities property conditions will be maintained from the Arrangement level.
Leaving the field blank sets NON-RESETTING as the default option.
